neighbors.name: Tarrence James Crews
neighbors.claims: Tarrence James Crews (also listed as Terrence James Crews) is identified in property records as an owner of the residential property at 1536 S Rolling Rd ([homes.com](https://www.homes.com/property/1536-s-rolling-rd-halethorpe-md/mkd2z76vxk377/)). Limited public information exists regarding his civic involvement, though records indicate he previously participated in collegiate athletics (football) at Lycoming College around 2015 ([athletics.lycoming.edu](https://s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/sidearm.nextgen.sites/athletics.lycoming.edu/documents/2015/2/13/stevenson.pdf)). No public statements or documented positions by Crews on development, zoning, or land use issues were found in Baltimore County archives.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private citizen; no known public office or leadership roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach as a younger homeowner. Given the lack of contentious zoning history, focus on how the project protects long-term property stability. Keep communication direct and informal.

citations.claim: Identified as owner of 1536 S Rolling Rd
citations.title: 1536 S Rolling Rd Property Record

citations.claim: Played collegiate football at Lycoming College
citations.title: Lycoming College Football Roster

neighbors.name: Linda L. Cain
neighbors.claims: Linda Lee Cain passed away on May 2, 2025, at the age of 82 ([cremationsocietyofmd.com](https://www.cremationsocietyofmd.com/obituaries/linda-cain)). She was a resident of 709 Woodland Drive and the spouse of Barbara Jones ([cremationsocietyofmd.com](https://www.cremationsocietyofmd.com/obituaries/linda-cain)). Cain was an active member of the Catholic Community of Relay in Baltimore County, where she volunteered in roles such as ringing the church bell ([cremationsocietyofmd.com](https://www.cremationsocietyofmd.com/obituaries/linda-cain)). Her obituary noted a deep appreciation for nature, the outdoors, and privacy ([cremationsocietyofmd.com](https://www.cremationsocietyofmd.com/obituaries/linda-cain)). Control of the property interests likely resides with her surviving spouse, Barbara Jones.

approach_recommendations.engage: Address all correspondence to Barbara Jones (surviving spouse). Acknowledge the family's recent loss if appropriate. Frame the project as compatible with the quiet, nature-oriented values Linda championed.

citations.claim: Active member of Catholic Community of Relay
citations.title: Obituary for Linda Lee Cain

neighbors.name: Sharyn L. Herman
neighbors.claims: Sharyn L. Herman is the owner of the property at 1538 S. Rolling Road ([baltimorecountymd.gov](https://www.baltimorecountymd.gov/files/Documents/Permits/Decisions/2022/September/21166a.pdf)). In 2021-2022, Herman actively opposed a zoning variance request (Case No. 21-166-A) filed by neighbors regarding the keeping of poultry ([baltimorecountymd.gov](https://www.baltimorecountymd.gov/files/Documents/Appeals/decisions2021/martin21166afinalopinionandorder.pdf)). She appeared as a Protestant in the Board of Appeals hearing, testifying that the 'constant and intolerable' noise from the animals disturbed her ability to work from home and deprived her of the quiet enjoyment of her property ([baltimorecountymd.gov](https://www.baltimorecountymd.gov/files/Documents/Permits/Decisions/2022/September/21166a.pdf)). She successfully utilized the Code Violation Complaint process to document her grievances ([baltimorecountymd.gov](https://www.baltimorecountymd.gov/files/Documents/Permits/Decisions/2022/September/21166a.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Demonstrated willingness to engage in legal/zoning appeals

approach_recommendations.engage: Exercise extreme caution regarding noise and visual nuisance. Herman has a documented history of formally contesting neighbor activities that impact her quiet enjoyment. Pre-emptively share acoustic studies and setback details.

citations.title: Baltimore County Administrative Hearings Case 2021-0166-A Opinion

citations.claim: Appeared as Protestant in Case 21-166-A opposing variance
citations.title: Baltimore County Board of Appeals Opinion Case 21-166-A

citations.claim: Testified regarding noise nuisance and Code Violation Complaints
citations.title: Baltimore County Administrative Hearings Case 2021-0166-A Opinion
